text.p: These are the leading stories in the Turkish press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Tension between Turkey and Germany mounts because of an irresponsible German judge's accusations that the Turkish government protects international drugs trade.
- Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu says in interview that he is pleased with the Islamist-led government in Turkey.
- Wife of the wanted gangster at the centre of a security scandal, Abdullah Catli, tells parliamentary commission her husband worked in secret missions abroad for the state.
- President Suleyman Demirel sees as positive a businessmen's report urging more democratisation.
- Photographs of the head of the police special team next to fugitive mobster Catli prove that the state has links to the underworld.
- High school pupils protest at the education system.
- The new owner of the recently privatised Etibank aims to open branches abroad.
- Turkish foreign ministry says the German police used only the Turkish press as a source for drug allegations against Ciller.
